creator: jan@materne.de
text:
I added some words about the populated objects, some links to external 
resources (Rhino homepage, Ant javadoc) and an additional example where I use 
the Ant-API and Java API.

Created attachment 6848
Diff for the docu: docs\manual\OptionalTasks\script.html
creator: jan@materne.de
peter.reilly@corvil.com
text:
This is great, however it includes a reference
to the ant javadocs. This may confuse people that
use the ant site directly for the manual, they
will get redirected to gump for the main reference.

creator: jan@materne.de
text:
Thanks.

Ok, I have forgotten that the javadocs are not available directly under Ant´s 
homepage (I use my local copy). But they are too important, because all you are 
doing is via the Ant classes. Should I do a link to 
cvs.apache.org/viewcvs... ? :-)

I think the hint that the javadoc isn´t online and you can see it on nagoya 
server is enough - but maybe the deep links (Project, Task, Script) wouldn´t 
work. But how many people are using the manual offline and how many online?

The deep links do not work, but the top link does
give the correct whine message.
(I do not know the reason the ant site does
not have the javadocs on-line - it does seem
a little strange).

Anyways, I have commited the patch, cheers.
Peter
creator: peter.reilly@corvil.com

text:
Oh, some months ago there was a discussion on the dev-list about the online-
javadoc. For short: no consens which should be put online: the version of the 
last release or the current CVS version. So the conclusion was the text and the 
link to nagoya.

Thanks for commiting.
creator: jan@materne.de
